00043 // Check for Berkeley DB version
00044 #if (DB_VERSION_MAJOR != 4) || (DB_VERSION_MINOR < 7)
00045 #error Berkeley DB 4.7 or later is required.
00046 #endif

00058 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00059 //  Berkeley DB version.
00060 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00061 
00069 void version (int * major, int * minor, int * patch)
00070 {
00071     char * ver = db_version(major, minor, patch);
00072     LOG4CPLUS_DEBUG(logger, "[bdb::version] " << ver);
00073 }
00074 
00075 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00076 //  Marshaling btw Berkeley DB and Protocol Buffers.
00077 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00078 
00090 void serialize (const Message * from,   
00091                 DBT           * to)     
00092 {
00093     string str;
00094     from->SerializeToString(&str);
00095 
00096     memset(to, 0, sizeof(DBT));
00097 
00098     to->data = malloc(str.size());
00099     memcpy(to->data, str.c_str(), str.size());
00100 
00101     to->flags = DB_DBT_USERMEM | DB_DBT_APPMALLOC;
00102     to->size = to->ulen = str.size();
00103 }
00104 
00108 void unserialize (const DBT * from,     
00109                   Message   * to)       
00110 {
00111     string str((char *) from->data, from->size);
00112     to->ParseFromString(str);
00113 }
00114 
00118 void release (DBT * dbt)    
00119 {
00120     if (dbt->data != NULL)
00121     {
00122         free(dbt->data);
00123         memset(dbt, 0, sizeof(DBT));
00124     }
00125 }
00126 
00127 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00128 //  Memory allocation functions.
00129 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00130 
00135 void * malloc (size_t size)
00136 {
00137     return ::malloc(size);
00138 }
00139 
00144 void * realloc (void * ptr, size_t size)
00145 {
00146     return ::realloc(ptr, size);
00147 }
00148 
00153 void free (void * ptr)
00154 {
00155     ::free(ptr);
00156 }
